metadata.author: Jonathan Mathieu
notes: All numerical entries are priors (pre-Hera), not posteriors.
Where physical units/normalizations are ambiguous (e.g., gravity harmonics conventions), wide conservative priors are used.
Rotation-regime priors incorporate published expectation of persistent NPA state at Hera arrival.
primary_anchors: Dimorphos expected to remain in NPA (tumbling) at Hera arrival (late 2026).
Bulk density estimates remain broad; use wide priors on mass-related parameters.

definition.R1: principal-axis rotation but measurably excited (non-synchronous), no clear NPA signature

confidence_rationale: Published post-DART lightcurve analyses predict persistent NPA state at Hera arrival; hence R2 dominates.
Residual probability is reserved for unexpected rapid damping or misclassification due to viewing geometry.

gravity_coefficients.convention: dimensionless zonal/tesseral harmonics; normalization to be matched to Hera team reporting (pre-registered as transform-invariant via z-scoring to a common convention).

C22.interpretation: equatorial elongation / triaxiality proxy (broad prior; rubble-pile plausible range).

libration_signature.observable: libration / NPA energy decay proxy measured over Hera observation window

decay_exponent.interpretation: power-law decay exponent p in A(t) ~ t^{-p} when applicable

characteristic_timescale_days.interpretation: effective damping/relaxation timescale (days), wide due to uncertain interior + rubble pile dissipation

implementation_notes: All model variants must be evaluated using identical data cuts and identical convention-mapping for gravity harmonics.
If Hera provides C20 instead of J2, conversion will be applied using standard spherical-harmonic relations pre-registered as deterministic mapping.
Rotation regime classification must be performed blind to model label.
